meanings.definition: The part of a lathe that supports the end of a workpiece.
meanings.sent1: The tailstocks on the lathe held the wooden piece steady.
meanings.sent2: The machinist adjusted the tailstocks to secure the metal rod.
meanings.sent3: The tailstocks decided to take a break from their spinning duties.
meanings.sent4: The tailstocks stood firm like a loyal guardian at the end of the lathe.
meanings.sent5: The tailstocks, like a sturdy pillar, provided stability to the workpiece.

meanings.definition: A device used in metalworking to hold a workpiece in place.
meanings.sent1: The tailstocks clamped down firmly on the metal block.
meanings.sent2: The technician adjusted the tailstocks to secure the steel pipe.
meanings.sent3: The tailstocks were feeling quite important holding the workpiece in position.
meanings.sent4: The tailstocks acted like a reliable hand keeping the workpiece steady.
meanings.sent5: The tailstocks were the unsung heroes of the metalworking process, ensuring precision.

meanings.definition: The part of a machine that moves in a straight line to support a moving part.
meanings.sent1: The tailstocks smoothly glided along the lathe's bed to assist the turning process.
meanings.sent2: The operator adjusted the tailstocks to align with the rotating shaft.
meanings.sent3: The tailstocks were the elegant dancers of the machine, moving gracefully.
meanings.sent4: The tailstocks acted like a guiding hand, ensuring the part moved accurately.
meanings.sent5: The tailstocks were like the steady heartbeat of the machine, supporting its movements.
